sponsor.partnerMessage: Emcar Stone Studio is now serving NWA! They are a family owned and operated full service fabrication and installation company that specializes in quartz, granite, marble, and quartzite countertops. Contact them today for a complimentary quote!

posts.title: Pinnacle Hills to Have A New Medical Office
posts.content:
The Pinnacle Hills area in Rogers is filling up with new businesses and offices, making it quite the district with world class centers throughout. 

  • For patients: A new medical office will be built on S. Champion Dr. and will be for Advanced Orthopedic Specialists (AOS) and the Northwest Arkansas Center for Plastic Surgery & Skin Care Center (NWACPS). An on-site surgical center is expected to improve patient experience. 
  • Location: The immediate access off of the highway makes it an ideal location for the medical offices. The building will be three stories and almost 46k sq/ft. The estimated time for construction is 12mos. 

Click HERE for more information.

posts.title: A New Co-Working Space In Rogers
posts.content:
There’s a new, unique shared workspace in Rogers called The CoFounder, making it the first of its kind in the Rogers area. 

  • The office: It recently opened in Founders Plaza, which is a five story, 117,000 sq/ft building in Pinnacle Hills. It’s a Class A office building in which The CoFounder has nearly 9,000 sq/ft of co-working space. 
  • Space of the future: The CoFounder has 17 private offices, a kitchen, conference rooms, plenty of couches and booths, and an outdoor space for food trucks. Some believe co-working spaces are the future of offices, promoting flexibility, diverse interaction, and a more autonomous work life. 

For more information, click HERE.

posts.title: UAMS Expands In NWA
posts.content:
Northwest Arkansas is about to have a bigger University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences (UAMS) footprint after multiple approved projects. 

  • Plans: An orthopedic and sports medicine center near I-49 in Springdale is a recently approved UAMS project as part of an NWA expansion. 
  • Land: The most recent project approval is the acquisition of 48 acres of land in Rogers near I-49 for a UAMS operation. There are no specific plans yet, but the land will be purchased for $8m and an additional 4 acres will be gifted to the facility. 

For more information, click HERE.

posts.title: Charlie And The Chocolate Factory At The WAC
posts.content:
Get your golden ticket to Roald Dahl’s Charlie and the Chocolate Factory on Broadway, showing at the Walton Arts Center until Dec. 5. 

  • A sweet treat: Experience the story you know and love like never before. The songs “Pure Imagination,” “The Candy Man,” and “I’ve Got A Golden Ticket” from the original movie are in the show alongside a new score from the songwriters of Hairspray.
  • An add on: Before the show on Dec. 3, there will be a Cocktail Class for individuals 21+. You’ll learn how to make show-themed cocktails yourself and enjoy them with light appetizers. You can book the class along with your show tickets, though spaces are limited!

Book show tickets HERE.

posts.title: Fayetteville Ranked Among Best College Cities
posts.content:
Fayetteville has been weighed and measured and found to be one of the best college cities in the US. 

  • Another list: WalletHub compared over 400 US cities of numerous sizes and ranked them based on academic, social, and economic opportunities for students. Fayetteville ranked #20 overall, its "wallet friendliness" being a driving factor in its placement.
  • The place to be: Being a top ranked college city as well as the 4th best place to live in the US says a lot about the culture of Fayetteville. With its arts and entertainment, sports, outdoor recreation and connectivity to surrounding areas, we must agree it’s a pretty great place. 

See the ranking of college cities HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Outdoors: Hobbs State park released its December schedule.
  • Honors: Razorbacks are about to line the Sports Hall of Fame.
  • A rising state: It's seriously looking like we're the new Austin.
  • Air travel: Allegiant has expanded its routes from XNA once again.
  • Dedicated fans: Pittman has a street side shrine in Fayetteville. Have you seen?
  • Get together: Let's talk about putting your business or event in the newsletter!
